Description: Part of upper body (reconstructed from 23 fragments, about half joining, and plaster inserts) of Milesian Fikellura pottery oinochoe; cream slip; exterior: from top, painted frieze of tongues around neck with dots in interstices; below, animal frieze: from left, sphinx (part of head and hind leg missing) to right; goat (part of head and neck missing) to right; sphinx (tail, rump, part of wing, and back remaining) to left, deer (part of hind legs missing) to right, and partridge, to right at end of panel; all figures except partridge have added purple; dot rosettes and pendent lotus flowers as filling ornaments; below, dividing band of dot and billet pattern above four friezes of crescents alternating in orientation; below, another dividing band of dot and billet pattern above lotus bud and flower frieze.
Curator's comments: The sherd was analysed with NAA by Hans Mommsen (sample Nauk 41: singleton). The origin of the fabric was not identified. Other sherds in the 1888,0601.561 sequence probably belong.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 56.)
Cook 1933-1934 / Fikellura Pottery (p. 42, no. T4, pl. 14 c)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 60)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.122)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 132-3, Nau 98, pl. 22a)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (no. 37, pl. 4)
